intro: Calliandra involuta, commonly known as the curled calliandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, curled foliage and showy clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, recurved leaflets that give it a unique appearance. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in warm climates. Calliandra involuta also has potential ecological benefits, as it can fix nitrogen in the soil, improving soil fertility.
